lead_paragraph: PERLMAN--Claire Field, age 91, died Monday, February 15. Daughter of the late Helen and Sam Field, Claire was born in New York City and lived in Woodmere. She was married to the late Sidney Perlman. Claire's belief in helping others made her an active volunteer: typing books in Braille, serving as vice president and board member of the Samuel Field YM-YWHA for many years. Claire was a generous donor to numerous charitable organizations including UJA Federation of New York, The Samuel Field YM-YWHA, and Israel Goldstein Youth Village and Ramat Hadassah in Israel. Claire is survived by her daughter, Toni Young, son John (Maxine) Perlman, and stepson, Jim Mindling, as well as five grandchildren, Mitchell Young (Katka), Ann Young Saban (Hanoch), Betsy Perlman, Sam Perlman, and Natasha Mindling. She had two great-grandsons, Giladi Shmuel Saban and another who will be named at his bris on February 17, 2016. Special thanks are given to her outstanding team of caregivers in her final years, Patricia Muir, Dawn Hutchinson, Gladys Barnes, Valerie DaCosta, and others. In lieu of flowers, contributions can be made to the Samuel Field YM-YWHA, or the charity of your choice. Funeral services handled by Riverside Chapel: 516-295-3100. 1/3
